summary: Facade methods throw RuntimeException instead of the documented OutOfContextException when called from wrong context. The OutOfContextException class appears to be unused in the codebase.
userImpact: Developers cannot rely on catching the documented OutOfContextException and must instead catch RuntimeException, breaking the documented API contract.
rootCause: Facade methods throw RuntimeException directly instead of OutOfContextException; the OutOfContextException class is defined but never used.
keyQuote: Calling facade methods can only be made from the currently running process
